thread.title: $4K in gift cards stolen from Home Depot in Gwinnett
thread.title_full: $4K in gift cards stolen from Home Depot in Gwinnett

author: Steve Burns
title: $4K in gift cards stolen from Home Depot in Gwinnett
text:
Gwinnett County police are seeking four men who allegedly stole more than $4,000 of activated, prepaid gift cards from a Home Depot in Norcross.
The men used the cards to get cash at Publix stores in DeKalb County, Cpl. Deon Washington said.
The theft was reported Jan. 15 by a Home Depot cashier, Washington said. Since then, the cashier has admitted that he helped in the theft. He was arrested Jan. 24 on charges of false report of a crime and theft by taking.
$4,000 of gift cards stolen from Home Depot. Suspects captured on Publix video surveillance cashing the cards. @StopCrimeATL for cash reward pic.twitter.com/Y4cJJBLKZb
â€” Gwinnett Police Dept (@GwinnettPd) February 17, 2017 The men at large are described as 5-foot-9 to 5-foot-11 and weighing 140 to 170 pounds, Washington said. They were driving a gold or beige Mercedes-Benz.
Anyone with information is asked to call police at 770-513-5300. Also, tipsters can remain anonymous, and be eligible for rewards of up to $2,000, by contacting Crime Stoppers Atlanta at 404-577-8477, texting information to 274637 or visiting crimestoppersatlanta.org .
